Hey, Mac users! If you're getting the "can't verify the integrity of the installer" message, there's an easy fix!

I'm still in the process of following aeristilheartly's guide, so I haven't verified that this works fully, but I did manage to run the installer.

Most of the expansions are running from disk images (.iso, .dmg, etc.), but this one is just files when you decompress the .rar.

I realized that the installer was probably looking for a disk image, so I fired up Disk Utility (comes with Mac OS, should be in /Applications/Utilities, otherwise search for it) and made a disk image from the folder (File > New > Disk Image from Folder) that was generated from the .rar.

Once I ran the installer from the disk image, it seemed to install normally. Here's me crossing my fingers that it'll work once I've got all the expansion packs in.
